General course objectives:
General course objectives
The purpose of the course is to introduce students to technologies for creating scalable startups leveraging the potential of generative AI, by utilizing high level application frameworks to design prototype concepts, and assess their business potential as well as societal impact.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Identify trustworthy AI core abilities to address user needs
Compare AI approaches to optimize market value
Combine AI functionalities into products for potential customers
Apply AI technologies to prototype multimodal concepts as cloud solutions or integrated with hardware
Evaluate AI concepts and assure data transparency using different types of metrics
Assess AI potential value versus implementation challenges
Optimize market value for implementing AI prototype
Define agile strategy to maximize outcome of AI solution
Content: The course focuses on prototyping generative AI concepts, combined with business modeling tools for identifying and optimizing their market value. Lectures will introduce high level frameworks for designing GPT language model (LLM) applications and diffusion based image generation using Jupyter Notebook examples. Based on short videos that explain the Python code examples, the lectures will introduce business related use cases ranging from SWOT analysis and design thinking to startup scenario simulation, by conceptualizing LLM applications that extend GPT models with chain-of-thought (COT) agents and retrieval augmented generation (RAG) of content.
Course literature: Online videos, Jupyter Notebook Python code examples, as well as scientific articles made available through DTU Learn.
